tit.e: "Toka No Sechie" (A Former Imperial Court Ceremony)
"Toka No Sechie" (A Former Imperial Court Ceremony)
tit.cmt: タイトルのため、括弧内の補足は削除しました。

sen.j: 踏歌節会（とうかのせちえ/たふかのせちゑ）は、宮中で、天皇が踏歌を見物する正月の年中行事。
sen.e: "Toka no sechie" was an event that the emperor watched "toka" (stamping songs) in the Imperial Court every January (by the lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: ・セル21にあるように、現在は宮中の行事ではないので過去形にしています。 ・ここでいう「正月」はセル6から「一月」の意味と解されます。
sen.e: "Toka no sechie" was an event where the emperor watched "toka" (stamping songs) in the Imperial Court every January (by the lunar calendar).
Toka no sechie was an event where the emperor watched toka (stamping songs) in the Imperial Court every January (by the lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 五位以上の者を招いて宴も開かれた。
sen.e: Along with toka no sechie, a banquet was also held, to which court nobles of the Fifth Rank and higher were invited.
Along with toka no sechie, a banquet was also held, to which court nobles of the Fifth Rank and higher were invited.
Along with toka no sechie, a banquet was also held, to which court nobles of Goi (Fifth Rank) and higher were invited.
sen.cmt: 五位 を追加しました。

sen.j: 男踏歌（おとことうか）と女踏歌（おんなとうか）に分かれ、男踏歌は正月14日または15日に、女踏歌は16日に行われる。
sen.e: Toka no sechie was divided into two categories, "otoko toka" (the stamping song event of men) held on January 14 or 15 (by the lunar calendar) and "onna toka" (the stamping song event of women) held on January 16 (by the lunar calendar).

Toka no sechie was divided into two categories, "otoko toka" (the stamping song event of men) held on January 14th or 15th (by the lunar calendar) and "onna toka" (the stamping song event of women) held on January 16th (by the lunar calendar).

Toka no sechie was divided into two categories, otoko toka (the stamping song event of men) held on January 14 or 15 (by the lunar calendar) and onna toka (the stamping song event of women) held on January 16 (by the lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 踏歌の史料初見は、『日本書紀』の持統天皇7年正月16日記事の「漢人等奏踏歌」である。
sen.e: The first appearance of toka on historical materials was the article of "toka performed by Han Chinese and others" on February 21 (January 16 by the lunar calendar), 687, which is included in "Chronicle of Japan."

The first appearance of toka in historical materials was in an article about "toka performed by Han Chinese and others" on February 21st (January 16th by the lunar calendar), 687 A.D., which is included in the "Chronicle of Japan."

The first appearance of toka in historical materials was in an article about 'toka performed by Han Chinese and others' on March 1 (January 16 by the lunar calendar), 693 which is included in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan).
sen.cmt: "→ ' に変更しました。日本書紀 追加しました。グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。ここでは「毎年正月16日に踏歌が行われている」とのことなので、（旧暦での1月１6日）との記載も残しています）

sen.j: 『続日本紀』の742年（天平14年）1月16日の記事に少年童女が踏歌を行ったとあるから、この頃までには広まっていたものと考えられる。
sen.e: The article on March 1 (January 16 by the lunar calendar), 742, in "Chronicle of Japan Continued" says boys and little girls showed toka, which indicates toka seem to have become popular by then.

The article on March 1st (January 16th by the lunar calendar), 742 A.D., in "Chronicle of Japan Continued" states that boys and little girls performed toka dances, which indicates toka seems to have become popular by then.

The article on March 1 (January 16 by the lunar calendar), 742, in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) states that boys and little girls performed toka dances, which indicates toka seems to have become popular by then.
sen.cmt: 続日本紀 追加しました。A.D.を削除しました。

sen.j: 光孝天皇の代まで、ほぼ毎年1月16日に女踏歌が行われた。
sen.e: Until the era of Emperor Koko, onna toka had been held on January 16 (by the lunar calendar) almost every year.
Until the era of Emperor Koko, onna toka had been held on January 16th (by the lunar calendar) almost every year.
Until the era of Emperor Koko, onna toka had been held on January 16 (by the lunar calendar) almost every year.

sen.j: 889年（寛平元年）に男踏歌が1月14日におこなわれてから、多くは1月14日に男踏歌が行われたが、955年（天暦9年）に一時、踏歌は中止される。
sen.e: From February 21 (January 14 by the lunar calendar), 889, otoko toka was held mostly on January 14 (by the lunar calendar), but in 955, toka were temporarily halted.
From February 21st (January 14th by the lunar calendar), 889 A.D., otoko toka was held mostly on January 14th (by the lunar calendar), but in 955 A.D., toka dances were temporarily halted.
From February 21 (January 14 by the lunar calendar), 889, otoko toka was held mostly on January 14 (by the lunar calendar), but in 955, toka dances were temporarily halted.
sen.cmt: stを削除し、21としました。A.D.を削除しました。

sen.j: 冷泉天皇の代から再び行われるようになったが、983年（永観元年）1月14日に行われた踏歌を最後に男踏歌は中止され、女踏歌だけが毎年行われるようになった。
sen.e: Toka were restarted under the reign of Emperor Reizei, but on March 6 (January 14 by the lunar calendar), 983, otoko toka ended its life, and just onna toka continued to be held annualy.

Toka dances were restarted under the reign of Emperor Reizei, but on March 6th (January 14th by the lunar calendar), 983 A.D., otoko toka ceased being performed, and just onna toka continued to be held annually.

Toka dances were restarted under the reign of Emperor Reizei, but on March 6 (January 14 by the lunar calendar), 983, otoko toka ceased being performed, and just onna toka continued to be held annually.
sen.cmt: thを削除し、6としました。A.D.を削除しました。

sen.j: その間にも、1012年（長和元年）から約10年間（寛仁年間）までは女踏歌も中絶した。
sen.e: For a decade from 1012, even onna toka was halted.
For a decade after 1012 A.D., even onna toka was halted.
For a decade after 1012, even onna toka was halted.

sen.j: その後、1519年（永正16年）以後、乱世が続くに及んで女踏歌も廃絶し、江戸時代は、正規のものはほとんど行われなかった。
sen.e: In 1519, onna toka also ended its life because the turbulent times were prolonged from this year, and during the Edo period, formal toka were rarely performed.
In 1519 A.D., even onna toka was no longer performed due to the prolonged turbulent times that year, and during the Edo period, formal toka dances were rarely performed.
In 1519, even onna toka was no longer performed due to the prolonged turbulent times that year, and during the Edo period, formal toka dances were rarely performed.

sen.j: 現在では1月11日に熱田神宮で踏歌神事が行われている。
sen.e: At present, toka Shinto ritual is held annually on January 11 at Atsuta-jingu Shrine.
At present, the toka Shinto ritual is held annually on January 11th at Atsuta-jingu Shrine.
At present, the toka Shinto ritual is held annually on January 11 at Atsuta-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 男踏歌
sen.e: Otoko toka
sen.cmt: ・以下、過去に行われた行事の内容なので、やはり過去形にしています。
sen.e: Otoko toka
Otoko toka

sen.j: 男踏歌は、正月14日または15日に行われる。
sen.e: Otoko toka was held on January 14 or 15 (by the lunar calendar).
Otoko toka was held on January 14th or 15th (by the lunar calendar).
Otoko toka was held on January 14 or 15 (by the lunar calendar).

sen.j: 14日、天皇は清涼殿東孫廂南第四間に出御する。
sen.e: On January 14, the emperor appeared on the southern fourth section of the eastern additional aisle of "Seiryoden" (literally, "Limpid Cool Hall," an Imperial summer palace).
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On January 14th, the emperor appeared on the southern fourth section of the eastern hall of "Seiryoden" (literally, "Limpid Cool Hall," an Imperial summer palace).
sen.cmt: I don't understand "additional aisle", though, I'm not sure "hall" is more accurate.
sen.e: On January 14, the emperor appeared on the southern fourth section of the eastern hall of Seiryoden (literally, "Limpid Cool Hall," an Imperial summer palace).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 内蔵寮は被綿を、作物所は綿花日杖をそれぞれ奉る。
sen.e: And to the emperor, the officer of "Kuraryo" (Bureau of Palace Storehouses) dedicated "kisewata" (the floss silk that absorbs the fragrance and the dew of a flower of chrysanthemum by covering the flower overnight, which was believed to keep the perpetual youth and longevity), and the officer of "Tsukumodokoro" (the palace office responsible for making accessories and furnishings) dedicated artificial flowers decorated with cotton respectively.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処 ・「被綿（きせわた）」については下記PDFを参照の上、「ひと晩菊の花をおおうことでその露や香りをうつしとった真綿。不老長寿を保つのに効果があるとされた。」と解説しています。 [http://www2.city.suginami.tokyo.jp/library/file/190911kisewata.pdf] ・「綿花（わたばな）」とは「綿で作った造花」のことで、男踏歌の際、舞人が冠に付けて踊ったものです（旺文社・古語辞典[第十版]）。
sen.e: And to the emperor, the officer of "Kuraryo" (Bureau of Palace Storehouses) presented "kisewata" (floss silk that absorbs the fragrance and the dew of a chrysanthemum by covering the flower overnight, which was believed to help maintain perpetual youth and longevity), and the officer of "Tsukumodokoro" (the palace office responsible for making accessories and furnishings) presented artificial flowers decorated with cotton.

And to the emperor, the officer of Kuraryo (Bureau of Palace Storehouses) presented kisewata (floss silk that absorbs the fragrance and the dew of a chrysanthemum by covering the flower overnight, which was believed to help maintain perpetual youth and longevity), and the officer of Tsukumo-dokoro (the palace office responsible for making accessories and furnishings) presented artificial flowers decorated with cotton.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。Tsukumo-dokoro とハイフンを入れ、他の記事と合わせ表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 王卿を召す。
sen.e: "Okei" (imperial family members and court nobles) were invited to the event.
sen.cmt: ・「王卿」は「天皇家一族と貴族」の意味に解しています。
sen.e: "Okei" (imperial family members and court nobles) were invited to the event.
Okei (imperial family members and court nobles) were invited to the event.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 多くは長橋に円座を敷き参席する。
sen.e: Most of them were seated on the round mats that were placed on "Nagahashi" (the corridor from Seiryoden to "Shishinden" [the hall for state ceremonies]).
Most of them were seated on the round mats that were placed on "Nagahashi" (the corridor from Seiryoden to "Shishinden" [the hall for state ceremonies]).
Most of them were seated on the round mats that were placed on nagahashi (the corridor from Seiryoden to Shishinden [the hall for state ceremonies]).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 御厨子所は御料の酒肴を供して、内蔵寮は王卿にこれをたまう。
sen.e: The emperor's "sake" (Japanese liquor) and the accompaniment, prepared by the officer of "Mizushidokoro" (the cooking section in court for the emperor), were handed out by the officer of Kuraryo to okei.
sen.cmt: ・「御料（ごりょう）の酒肴（しゅこう）」は「天皇のお酒とそのさかな」の意味です。
sen.e: The emperor's "sake" (Japanese liquor) and food, prepared by the officer of "Mizushidokoro" (the cooking section in court for the emperor), was handed out by the officer of Kuraryo to the okei.
The emperor's sake (Japanese liquor) and food, prepared by the officer of Mizushi-dokoro (the cooking section in court for the emperor), was handed out by the officer of Kuraryo to the okei.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。Mizushi-dokoro とハイフンを入れ、他の記事と合わせ表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 踏歌の舞人は右近陣前庭から楽を奏しつつ仙華門をはいって庭前にすすむ。
sen.e: Performing "gagaku" (ancient Japanese court music), toka dancers came from the forecourt of Shishinden, went under "Senkamon" (Senka Gate), and entered the forecourt of Seiryoden.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処 ・なお、原文の「仙華門（せんかもん）」は、上記古語辞典のP1565平安京内裏の見取図によると「月華門（げっかもん）」の誤りではないか、と解されますが、あえてそのまま訳しています。なお、この図は以下のセルにおいても適宜参考にしています。
sen.e: Performing "gagaku" (ancient Japanese court music), toka dancers came from the forecourt of Shishinden, went under "Senkamon" (Senka Gate), and entered the forecourt of Seiryoden.
Performing gagaku (ancient Japanese court music), toka dancers came from the forecourt of Shishinden, went under Senka-mon Gate, and entered the forecourt of Seiryoden.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 三度周旋ののち御前にいたり、祝詞を奏上し、「竹河」を奏する。
sen.e: After making three rounds in the forecourt, the dancers came in front of the emperor, dedicated "Norito" (Shinto prayer), and perfromed "Takekawa" (Bamboo River, the title of a song of "saibara" [a genre of the Heian period Japanese court music]).
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処 ・ここに言う「周旋」は単に「回ること」を意味します。
sen.e: After making three rounds in the forecourt, the dancers came before the emperor, dedicated "Norito" (Shinto prayer), and performed "Takekawa" (Bamboo River, the title of a song of "saibara" [a genre of the Heian period Japanese court music]).

After making three rounds in the forecourt, the dancers came before the emperor, dedicated Norito (Shinto prayer), and performed 'Takekawa' (Bamboo River, the title of a song of "saibara" [a genre of the Heian period Japanese court music]).
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: この儀が終わって、舞人らは東面南階から上る。
sen.e: After this ritual, dancers came near to the emperor from the southern staircase of the eastern additional aisle of Seiryoden.
sen.cmt: ・「上る（のぼる）」とは「貴人（ここでは天皇と解されます）のおそばに参上する」の意味です（古語辞典）。 ・清涼殿の間取りについては上記古語辞典p1555を参照しました。
sen.e: After this ritual, dancers approached the emperor from the southern staircase of the eastern hall of Seiryoden.
After this ritual, dancers approached the emperor from the southern staircase of the eastern hall of Seiryoden.

sen.j: 内侍2人が左右から被綿をわかち、和琴を弾くもの以下に、六位蔵人が御簾中からこれを伝取し、庭中でこれを被（かづ）く。
sen.e: Two "naishi" (ladies-in-waiting to the emperor) cooperatively divided the kisewata, and "Rokui no Kurodo" (the person at the position of Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) received the divided kisewata from naishi behind the bamboo blind, and gave it to "wagon" (the Japanese harp) players and others in the forecourt as a reward for the performance.
sen.cmt: ・「被く」は「褒美として与える」の意味です（古語辞典）。
sen.e: Two "naishi" (ladies-in-waiting to the emperor) cooperatively divided the kisewata, and "Rokui no Kurodo" (the Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) received the divided kisewata from the naishi behind a bamboo blind, and gave it to the "wagon" (Japanese harp) players and others in the forecourt as a reward for their performance.

Two naishi (ladies-in-waiting to the emperor) cooperatively divided the kisewata, and Rokui no Kurodo (the Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) received the divided kisewata from the naishi behind a bamboo blind, and gave it to the wagon (Japanese harp) players and others in the forecourt as a reward for their performance.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 「我家」を奏し、北廊の戸から退出する。
sen.e: Then they performed "Ware Ie" (My House, the title of a saibara song), and went out from the exit at the end of the northern corridor of Seiryoden.
They then performed "Ware Ie" (My House, the title of a saibara song), and exited from the end of the northern corridor of Seiryoden.
They then performed 'Ware Ie' (My House, the title of a saibara song), and exited from the end of the northern corridor of Seiryoden.

sen.j: 女踏歌
sen.e: Onna toka
Onna toka
Onna toka

sen.j: 女踏歌は、正月16日に行われる。
sen.e: Onna toka was held on January 16 (by the lunar calendar).
Onna toka was held on January 16th (by the lunar calendar).
Onna toka was held on January 16 (by the lunar calendar).

sen.j: 天皇は南殿に出御し、王卿以下群臣を召し、酒饌をたまわるのは元日節会とおなじである。
sen.e: Just the same as in "Ganjitsu no sechie" (New Year's Festival), the emperor appeared on "Nanden" (another name of Shishinden), invited a large number of the retainers including okei, and gave them sake and foods.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処 ・「酒饌」は「酒と食べ物」です（角川・漢和辞典）。
sen.e: Similar to during the "Ganjitsu no sechie" (New Year's Festival), the emperor appeared on "Nanden" (another name of Shishinden), invited a large number of his retainers, including the okei, and provided them with sake and food.

Similar to the Ganjitsu no sechie (New Year's Festival), the emperor appeared on Nanden (another name of Shishinden), invited a large number of his retainers, including the okei, and provided them with sake and food.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 一献はてて国栖歌笛を奏し、二献三献にして舞妓が40人参入する。
sen.e: When the first dish was finished up, "Kuzu no Utabue" (the music and dance dedicated to the emperor by "kuzu" [people who lived in Mt. Yoshino, Yamato Province]) was performed, and when the second and third dishes were served, "maiko" (apprentice geisha) as many as 40 came.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処 ・「一献はてて」とは「最初の料理がすんで」の意味です（古語辞典）。 ・「国栖歌笛（くずのうたぶえ）」につき下記ホームページを参照の上、「国栖（大和国・吉野山中に暮らしていた人々）が天皇に奏上した歌笛のこと」と訳しています。[http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110005857941]
sen.e: When the first dish was finished, "Kuzu no Utabue" (the music and dance dedicated to the emperor by "kuzu" [people who lived in Mt. Yoshino, Yamato Province]) was performed, and when the second and third dishes were served, as many as 40 "maiko" (apprentice geisha) arrived.

When the first dish was finished, Kuzu no Utabue (the music and dance dedicated to the emperor by kuzu [people who lived in Mt. Yoshino, Yamato Province]) was performed, and when the second and third dishes were served, as many as 40 maiko (apprentice geisha) arrived.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: まず校書殿南端に当たって東面して立つ。
sen.e: First, when maiko arrived at the first southern corner of "Kyoshoden" (Palace Archives), they stood there facing the east.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処 ・このセルの文章はセル42と内容的にかみ合わない上に上記古語辞典の見取り図を見ると少々おかしいと思います。おそらくは、ここの「校書殿南端」は「校書殿北端」、「東面」は「南面」、とすべきではないでしょうか。（なお、英訳ではあえて原文のまま訳しています。）
sen.e: First, when the maiko arrived at the southern corner of "Kyoshoden" (Palace Archives), they would stand in place facing the east.
First, when the maiko arrived at the southern corner of Kyoshoden (Palace Archives), they would stand in place facing the east.
sen.cmt: 翻訳者の方の訳どおりにしています。

sen.j: 舞妓はさらに殿西から分かれて進む。
sen.e: Maiko divided into some groups, and further walked on the way on the western side of Kyoshoden.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The maiko divided into groups, and continued along the western side of Kyoshoden.
The maiko divided into groups, and continued along the western side of Kyoshoden.

sen.j: 校書殿南端から東折し、馳道を中にして分かれて南に進む。
sen.e: When they arrived at the first southern corner of Kyoshoden, they turned east and went forward on either side of "chido" (the road exclusive to the emperor), and when they reached the forecourt of Shishinden, they went south.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処 ・原文からは抜け落ちているようですが、校書殿南端から東折して行きつく先は紫宸殿の南庭なので、それを補って訳しています（下線部）。 女踏歌が紫宸殿南庭で行われる歌曲であることは、下記ホームページの「踏歌節会」の項目（同ページの下の方）からも明らかです。[http://www.iz2.or.jp/rokushiki/index.html]
sen.e: When they reached the first southern corner of Kyoshoden, they turned east and moved forward on either side of "chido" (the road exclusive to the emperor), and when they reached the forecourt of Shishinden, they moved south.

When they reached the first southern corner of Kyoshoden, they turned east and moved forward on either side of chido (the road exclusive to the emperor), and when they reached the forecourt of Shishinden, they moved south.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と合わせ、ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: さらに北環する大輪をえがいて廻る。
sen.e: Then they came north, drawing a big circle.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They then moved north, forming a large circle.
They then moved north, forming a large circle.

sen.j: 右廻一匝にしてまた左右にわかれて南行し、さらに内から北行して校書殿東庭にとどまる。
sen.e: After making a clockwise round, they divided into two groups and went south, and then came north and went out to the eastern forecourt of Kyoshoden.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処 ・原文からは抜け落ちているようですが、一旦紫宸殿南庭に入った以上ここでは「校書殿東庭に出た」という説明が必要と解されます（下線部）。
sen.e: After moving in a clockwise motion, they divided into two groups and moved south, then north and then exited to the eastern forecourt of Kyoshoden.
After moving in a clockwise motion, they divided into two groups and moved south, then north and then exited to the eastern forecourt of Kyoshoden.
sen.cmt: 翻訳者の方の訳どおりにしています。

sen.j: 東面して立って歌曲をうたい、終わって退出する。
sen.e: They stood facing the east, sang songs, and, after finishing songs, went out.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They stood facing the east, sang songs, and, upon completing their songs, they left.
They stood facing the east, sang songs, and, upon completing their songs, they left.

sen.j: 饗宴が終わって、舞妓は中宮に参入し、饗禄を給う。
sen.e: After a banquet, they visited "chugu" (Palace of the Empress) and were given the reward for the performance by the Empress.
